result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L Merrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to DOC by the end of business today (8/24/2022).

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail by 8/31/2022, to submit DNA sample.
Must have no contact with St. Croix Casino.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 4 days credit if revoked from probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon L Merrill

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation
Undecided

11:02 AM Defendant Brandon L Merrill in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Brandon L Merrill.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rockow provides court with agreement.  State moves to amend count 1 to 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a), misdemeanor.  Court amends count 1 to 943.20(1)(a)(3)(a), misdemeanor. DE pleads guilty to amended count 1. Court performs colloquy and finds plea is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently given, accepts plea, and finds guilty.  Argument by state.  Argument by defense. DE addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 
SW.
1 year probation - must report by end of business today.
Must have to contact with the St. Croix Casino.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Costs to be paid in 60 days. 
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail by 8/31/2022 to submit DNA sample. 

4 days credit if revoked.

Warrant quashed. Reset for plea hearing 8/24/22 at 11:00 AM (before Judge Boyle).  Bond reinstated.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Plea hearing set.  Bond continues.
